title: 1D Kinematics - average velocity with changing a

content.question: A cart begins to move from rest on a horizontal track. The acceleration of the cart as a function of time is shown in the graph. Which of the following correctly indicates the magnitude of the average velocity of the cart during the interval shown, and provides a valid explanation?

choices.label: Less than <math alttext="2 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> because the cart has a velocity of <math alttext="2 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> for the first half of the interval and zero velocity for the second half.

Less than <math alttext="2 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> because the cart is traveling at a speed of <math alttext="2 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> or less during the time interval.

Equal to <math alttext="2 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> because the cart is initially at rest and then moves at a constant speed of <math alttext="2 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> during the second half of the interval.

Equal to <math alttext="2 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> because the cart has an average acceleration of <math alttext="1 meter per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math> over an interval of <math alttext="2 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>.

content.answer: Less than <math alttext="2 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> because the cart is traveling at a speed of <math alttext="2 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> or less during the time interval.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
